data.content:
noun
US or chiefly Brit theatre , pl -aters
[count] a building where plays, shows, etc., are performed on a stage
the oldest theater in the city
a theater performance
the theater district in New York City - see also dinner theater
b US :a building or room in which movies are shown
The film is now showing in theaters.
a movie theater
a home theater
[noncount] plays in general or as a form of entertainment
We enjoyed a weekend of music, dance, and theater.
He was very fond of the theater and had purchased tickets for several performances.
Her interests include theater and poetry.
the theater of 16th-century England
a theater critic
the art or activity of performing in or producing plays on a stage
She majored in theater in college.
a course in American theater
His monologues made for good theater.
The play makes lively theater.
a theater troupe/company - see also community theater
[count] a place where important events or actions occur - usually singular
the theater of health-care reform
a large area where there is a war
He fought in the Pacific theater (of operations) in World War II.
[count] Brit :operating room

Danh từ
(từ Mỹ,nghĩa Mỹ) (như) thetre
